revised_title: The Detection and Analysis of Ozone in the Upper Atmosphere
tldr: This article discusses the methods used to detect and analyze ozone in the upper atmosphere. The authors developed a method using potassium iodide solution to distinguish ozone from other substances like oxides of nitrogen and hydrogen peroxide. They found that ozone occurs in small quantities at high altitudes and is formed by the action of ultra-violet light on oxygen. The authors also studied the effect of ultra-violet light on air to understand the concentration of ozone and other products that can be formed under different conditions.
